I thought the picture quality was fine enough, it didn't ruin the pleasure of watching the movie for my own part =)

But to get the best DVD9 to DVD5 convertion quality, you ought to use DVD Rebuilder and reencode with Cinema Craft Encoder, since it is  the best mpeg2 ("raw" dvd content) encoder out there, and the quality is waaaay better than a transcode, which is what clonedvd, dvdshrink and the like does.

Hope that helps =)

This one i used CLONEDVD that compress the files to be burned as a DVD at 4.34gb. Poor quality! Please try this one as i used  DVDFab Platinum, "DVD9". Hope you like this better!?

The problem with this release is it includes both theatrical and special edition versions, and the video is letterboxed widescreen, meaning there is black bars on top and bottom of the video so when you full screen it it has black space on the bottom, top, left, and right of the screen. That makes the resolution really low, and poor quality because of both movie versions included.
